segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to feel the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so quiet, like they know they’re doing something wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to tip that stool any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so innocent, just waiting for her cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is on the floor now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, like nothing is wrong inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange moment—so much tension but no one reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall and make everything worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
